By Lisa Shock on Saturday, June 14, 2003 - 10:08 am:

Well, I got involved a while back, when I started moderating the Tecmo Forums. I typed up, and sent in the suggestions people had posted for MR3.

I was also lucky enough to have the developers choose two of my ideas for custom rare monsters to be made for the US version: Fay & Eega. I corresponded with the art department a bit, getting the monsters to look just right!

Then I bought Monster Farm 3 when it came out, and started playing. Tecmo asked for suggestions again, and I was able to give them some tips (like have the ability to save while in town, and have the ability to skip drill animations, as well as showing them that PC games froze the shrine) on their message boards. Then they started calling me at home for advice while they worked on MR3, which would ship 6 months later. For about a month I played the game along with the official testers, on the phone for 4-6 hours a day to each other. (The US testers don't know much Japanese, and don't know much about ranching.)

While MR3 was in development, for several months after the MF3 release, Tecmo people would call and ask me questions, and when I could, I answered. I managed to submit a couple of bug reports, and found one tournament opponent monster with a Japanese name that would be offensive if used in English. The also hooked me up with the authors of the Prima guide, and I translated the game for them so they could play it. (They don't know any Japanese!) I spent two and a half weeks working full time for Prima.

I also posted here at MRM about my progress in the game, so gamers could learn about the game. I was recently ordered to stop posting at the monster-rancher.com ezboard, because I dared to say that the game didn't have combining -and I described the heart system! (Fade insisted that he had a copy of the game beta, and that combining was part of it! Richard Ryley emailed me and told me not to post unless I had solid proof of what I was posting.) They also accused me of not being able to read Japanese when I pointed out the cover of the MF3 strategy guide said the game has 201 monsters. (more were added to make 222 in the US version, but these people were conned into thinking there were going to be 600+ monsters, and didn't believe me...) So, I was pretty much stuck posting here at home, but that was just fine with me!
